Key Match Events: Northern Ireland had 12 attempts at goal in the first half, forcing Fedor Lapoukhov into seven saves.
Eoin Toal’s header came back off the post.
Northern Ireland had two goals ruled out in the first half.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael O’Neill expressed frustration with the result but praised the performance, highlighting the team's dominance in the first half and the creation of excellent chances.
O’Neill noted the learning curve for the team in not taking their chances and acknowledged the different feel of the second half as Belarus tightened up.
O’Neill mentioned the heavy pitch and the lack of match fitness for some senior players as factors affecting the game.
O’Neill emphasized the positive aspect of not being beaten and looked forward to the next home game against Bulgaria.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in a neutral venue in Zalaegerszeg, Hungary, and was behind closed doors.
This was considered one of Northern Ireland’s most awkward away fixtures in the Nations League campaign.
